none.description: No extended deck cards. Results in a much less forgiving, lower-scoring game.

stones.description: In this variant, the players place three impassable stones in the middle of the board.
stones.name: Stumbling Blocks

#setup.description: Starts with a "cross" of two tiles of each colour.

29tiles.description: If you just want a shorter game
29tiles.name: Shorter game (29 tiles)

exNihilo.description: Starts with an empty field, and the first three turns are placing tiles
exNihilo.name: Ex Nihilo

arbeiter.description: Each player controls one worker and cannot move the other. The victory condition is commensurately reduced to three pieces in a row instead of four.
arbeiter.name: Arbeiter

simplified.description: You only play with three pieces of each colour, and the grid is constrained to 7x7 instead of 9x9.
simplified.name: Learning game

#placement.description: Pieces must always be placed such that they're supported by at least one piece from below.
#placement.name: Gravity downwards

clear.description: If a row at the edge is entirely filled with pieces, it is cleared, and all pieces shift in that direction. A four-in-a-row takes priority over a shift. When used with the 4-directional variants, the board will shift in any directions where there are full rows. Note that this can result in board configurations that are not normally feasible, but it is a predictable behaviour.
clear.name: Clear

edge-drop-4.description: Pieces "drop" from the edges: you may place on a free space right before the first filled space from any edge. Edges cannot be blocked, so the pieces are actually dropped from the first free space from the edge.
edge-drop-4.name: Edge-drop-4

edge-grow-4.description: Pieces "grow" from the edges: you may place on any first free space from any edge.
edge-grow-4.name: Edge-grow-4

interior-gravity-4.description: Pieces appear from any free space on the board, then slide to the free space right before the first filled space in the direction of the closest edge. On the diagonal where it is equidistant to two edges, the piece will slide to the closest corner.
interior-gravity-4.name: Interior-gravity-4

swap-2.description: The first player places three pieces. The next player may do one of (1) place a single pieces to continue as player 2, (2) swap colours to play as player 1, or (3) place two more pieces and allow the opponent to decide to play as player 1 or player 2.
swap-2.name: Swap-2 opening

swap-5.description: For the first five pieces on the board, after placement, the next player has the option to swap colours.
swap-5.name: Swap-5 opening

#market.description: The market does not refill until the next player's turn.
#market.name: No refills

advanced.description: The advanced game has a shorter track anda more restrictive movement rule.
advanced.name: Advanced

continuous.description: The market is smaller but refills after each turn.
continuous.name: Continuous market

courtpawns.description: For variety, the roles of pawns and courts may be reversed.
courtpawns.name: Courts for Pawns

courts.description: The four courts are added to the draw deck.  When playing a court, advance a frog to the next available spot in your choice of the three suits (even in the advanced game).  When swapping courts for pawns, pawns will be added instead.
courts.name: Courts

crocodiles.description: Add hungry crocodiles to the pawn cards.  Crocodiles advance at the end of each round, sending any frog on their new space back to the Excuse.  This variant is intended for a two-player game, but you may add crocodiles at any player count.
crocodiles.name: Crocodiles

refills.description: The market may be refilled during a player's turn, by splitting their actions over two turns.
refills.name: Refills

#opening.description: The first player has to place their first stone in the centre of the board, and their second stone at least three intersections away from the centre.
#opening.name: Pro opening

long-pro.description: The first player has to place their first stone in the centre of the board, and their second stone at least four intersections away from the centre.
long-pro.name: Long pro opening

pass.description: After the opening phase, a player may pass instead of make a move to win the tiebreaker. If the board is filled without a winner, the player who passed wins. If no player passed, second player wins.
pass.name: Pass tiebreak

swap-1st.description: The first player places a stone anywhere on the board. The next player has the option to swap colours.
swap-1st.name: Swap-1st opening

swap-2.description: The first player places three stones. The next player may do one of (1) place a single stone to continue as player 2, (2) swap colours to play as player 1, or (3) place two more stones and allow the opponent to decide to play as player 1 or player 2.
swap-2.name: Swap-2 opening

swap-5.description: For the first five stones on the board, after placement, the next player has the option to swap colours.
swap-5.name: Swap-5 opening

#board.name: Size-4 board
#board.description: Smaller board where the king may only move one step at a time.

size-5.description: Larger board where the king may move like any other piece.
size-5.name: Size-5 board

#rules.name: Disallow full passes
#rules.description: You may not pass your free action, but you may pass undesired sacrifice actions

pass.description: After the opening phase, a player may pass instead of make a move to win the tiebreaker. If the board is filled without a winner, the player who passed wins. If no player passed, then the second player wins.
pass.name: Pass tiebreak

swap-2.description: The first player places three stones. The next player may do one of (1) place a single stone to continue as player 2, (2) swap colours to play as player 1, or (3) place two more stones and allow the opponent to decide to play as player 1 or player 2.
swap-2.name: Swap-2 opening

swap-5.description: For the first five stones on the board, after placement, the next player has the option to swap colours.
swap-5.name: Swap-5 opening

#setup.name: The Razeway
#setup.description: The board starts with six cards in a diagonal line.

extended.name: Extended deck
extended.description: Deck includes the Excuse, the Pawns, and the Courts (influence tokens may not be placed on any of these cards).

towers.name: Towers
towers.description: The board starts with four cards just inside of each corner.

oldcity.name: The Old City
oldcity.description: The board starts with six cards in a circular pattern.

#board.description: 9x9 "black hole" variant. Moving a piece onto the central hole removes the piece from the game.
#board.name: 9x9 board

hex5.name: Hexagonal board (base-5)
hex5.description: 9 pieces each, starting in clusters in the corners.

hex6.name: Hexagonal board (base-6)
hex6.description: 12 pieces each, 4 on each side. Moving a piece onto the central hole removes the piece from the game.

scrambled.description: Pieces are interspersed with each other instead of starting together on opposite sides of the board. (Doesn't apply to the hex5 board.)
scrambled.name: Scrambled Eggs

no-blocked.name: No blocked cells
no-blocked.description: No-unplayable-cells variant proposed by Luis Bolaños Mures. The first person to occupy half or more in a line claims the line.

capture.name: Capture
capture.description: Capture variant proposed by Luis Bolaños Mures. After each placement, all pieces in claimed lines are removed. In the original proposal, Luis suggests this variant be used with the no-blocked-cells variant.

freestyle.description: Players take turn placing their miners on the board. When all miners are placed, player 2 starts.
freestyle.name: Freestyle placement

ofkk.description: Pawns move like Chess kings, and drones move like Chess knights.
ofkk.name: Of Knights and Kings

five.description: The winner is the first to score three points.
five.name: Best of Five

three.description: The winner is the first to score two points.
three.name: Best of Three

#board.name: Moon board
#board.description: A hexhex5 board with a subdivided centre cell and tweaked edges to form a moon-type surface.

hex5.name: Hexhex 5 (61 spaces)
hex5.description: In this version, the pie offer is a single piece.

limping.name: Limping 5-6 (75 spaces)
limping.description: Two colours will have an extra cube.

simplified.name: Minimorph
simplified.description: Faster game with simplified capture formations. Deadlocks are not possible.

double.name: Duomorph
double.description: On each turn, place two new stones (orthogonally adjacent to each other) or capture one. Minimorph formations apply.

replace.name: Remorph
replace.description: Captured stones must be placed back on the board by their owner. Minimorph formations apply.

basic.description: Only walls and towers can be built (maximum stack size is 2).
basic.name: Basic MG

escape.description: The winning condition is to stalemate your opponent. Breaking through is not sufficient.
escape.name: Escape

static.description: No initial redistribution of a starting tower.
static.name: Static Start

#stars.name: Sunder
#stars.description: Every cell is a star point

constellation.name: Constellation
constellation.description: Stars in the corners and the centre

gyre.name: Gyre
gyre.description: Stars around the perimeter and in the centre (proposed by Mark Steere)

free.name: Free placement
free.description: Intended for players who communicate expectations before the game. Each player will be able to place as many stars as they wish.

captures.name: Enable Adere-style captures
captures.description: Pieces can move onto an opposing stack of the same height. Increases game length. Consider using smaller boards.

head-start.name: Head start
head-start.description: Both players start with two pieces on each opponent's edge.

noglobes.description: Neither player starts with any globes.
noglobes.name: No Starting Globes

captures.name: Custodial captures
captures.description: Sandwiching an enemy stone between two of yours converts it to your colour.

#capture.description: You may only capture exactly 2 stones in each line.
#capture.name: Default capture rules

#opening.description: The first player has to place their first stone in the centre of the board, and their second stone at least three intersections away from the centre.
#opening.name: Pro opening

#overline.description: You can win by forming a line of five or more stones
#overline.name: Overline allowed

#overtime-capture.description: The game ends immediately when a player makes a winning alignment.
#overtime-capture.name: No overtime capture

#self-capture.description: Players may place a stone in a formation where it is surrounded by opponent's pieces such that it would ordinarily result in a capture without consequences.
#self-capture.name: Self-capture ignored

capture-2-3.description: You may capture 2 or 3 stones in a line.
capture-2-3.name: Capture 2-3 (Keryo Pente)

long-pro.description: The first player has to place their first stone in the centre of the board, and their second stone at least four intersections away from the centre.
long-pro.name: Long pro opening

overline-forbidden.description: Any move that would create a line of six or more stones is illegal.
overline-forbidden.name: Overline forbidden

overline-ignored.description: Overline moves are legal, but they do not count as a win. It's possible to capture a stone such that your opponent wins. Draws are possible if both players simultaneously meet the win condition.
overline-ignored.name: Overline ignored

overtime-capture.description: When a player makes a winning alignment, the opponent has one move to try to break that alignment.
overtime-capture.name: Overtime capture (Boat Pente)

self-capture.description: When players place a stone in a formation where it is surrounded by opponent's pieces such that it would ordinarily result in a capture, those stones are removed as though the opponent captured them. All captures are determined before any removal is made. This means that if we initially had XO_XXO, and the O player places at the empty space, it results in X____O, and each player gains two points.
self-capture.name: Self-capture allowed (Poof Pente)

self-capture-forbidden.description: Players may not place their stones in a formation where it is surrounded by opponent's pieces such that it would ordinarily result in a capture.
self-capture-forbidden.name: Self-capture forbidden

swap-1st.description: The first player places a stone anywhere on the board. The next player has the option to swap colours.
swap-1st.name: Swap-1st opening

swap-2.description: The first player places three stones. The next player may do one of (1) place a single stone to continue as player 2, (2) swap colours to play as player 1, or (3) place two more stones and allow the opponent to decide to play as player 1 or player 2.
swap-2.name: Swap-2 opening

swap-5.description: For the first five stones on the board, after placement, the next player has the option to swap colours.
swap-5.name: Swap-5 opening

15pts.description: The game doesn't end until you have 15 points worth of enemy soldiers.
15pts.name: Longer Game: 15 points

#rules.name: Default rules
#rules.description: A piece must move higher and pieces that start with nothing beneath them can only end with a single piece beneath them.

jumpers.name: High jumpers
jumpers.description: A piece must move higher, but pieces that start with nothing beneath them are allowed to land on any other stack.

#komi.description: The first player will enter a number into the move input box on their first turn to define the second player bonus for the game. The second player will be given the option to switch seats afterwards.
#komi.name: Komi offer

nokomi.description: The game will be played without a second player bonus. Good for beginners.
nokomi.name: No komi offer

#setup.description: The board starts empty, and the first half of the game is the players placing their pyramids.

quickStart.name: Quick start
quickStart.description: A learning mode that randomly places the pyramids for you, so players start directly at the stacking half of the game.

#setup.description: The starting position will be an empty board.

random.description: The starting position will have some pre-flooded spaces.
random.name: Random setup

excuse.name: The Excuse
excuse.description: Adds The Excuse to the deck. This card accrues no basic scoring when played or when played next to, plays no role in straights, and it exacts no penalty if still in your hand at the end of the round.

flush.name: Flush bonuses
flush.description: When present, if the card you played creates or extends a continuous line (including diagonal) of four or more cards that share the same suit, or that forms a 2x2 square of cards that share a suit, score 10 points for each line and square.

capturedBases.description: The number of captured bases becomes a second tie breaker.
capturedBases.name: Tie break: Captured bases

checkpoint.description: Moving pieces must stop in the first enemy controlled realm they enter.
checkpoint.name: Checkpoint Charley

control.description: When rearranging a realm, you may also rearrange your opponent's pieces.
control.name: Control freak

lastFirst.description: After initial base and power placement, the second player moves first.
lastFirst.name: And the last shall be first

relaxed.description: There are no restrictions on initial base placement.
relaxed.name: Relaxed placement

replacement.description: Captured bases are immediately replaced by one of your own. Leads to a much faster game.
replacement.name: Capture by replacement

#opening.description: The first player has to place their first stone in the centre of the board. There are no other opening placement restrictions.
#opening.name: Centre opening

pass.description: After the opening phase, a player may pass instead of make a move to win the tiebreaker. If the board is filled without a winner, the player who passed wins. If no player passed, second player wins.
pass.name: Pass tiebreak

rif.description: Classic Renju International Federation rules. Select a canonical opening and the other player may swap. Two tentative fifths are given. <https://www.renju.net/rule/1/>
rif.name: Classic RIF opening

soosyrv-8.description: Official tournament rule since 2015. Starts like RIF, but upon placing the fourth stone, up to 8 tentative fifths can be declared, and the other player may swap. <https://www.renju.net/rule/24/>
soosyrv-8.name: Soosõrv-8 opening

swap-2.description: Free opening. The first player places three stones. The next player may do one of (1) place a single stone to continue as player 2, (2) swap colours to play as player 1, or (3) place two more stones and allow the opponent to decide to play as player 1 or player 2.
swap-2.name: Swap-2 opening

swap-5.description: Free opening. For the first five stones on the board, after placement, the next player has the option to swap colours.
swap-5.name: Swap-5 opening

taraguchi-10.description: Beginner-friendly rule that is popular in correspondence games. Each player places one stone during the opening and the other player may swap. 10-tentative-fifths rule is implemented in case a player tries to make an exploitive opening (beginners may ignore this). <https://www.renju.net/rule/25/>
taraguchi-10.name: Taraguchi-10 opening

yamaguchi.description: Official tournament rule from 2009 to 2015. Simple modification to the RIF opening where instead of a fixed number of tentative fifths (two), on the first move, the player declares the number of tentative fifths. <https://www.renju.net/rule/5/>
yamaguchi.name: Yamaguchi opening

anti.description: The player who has the fewest pieces at the end of the game wins.
anti.name: Anti-Reversi

hexagon-5.description: Hexagonal base-5 board with setup popularised by ItsYourTurn.com.
hexagon-5.name: Hexagonal board (base-5)

hexagon-6.description: Hexagonal base-6 board with setup popularised by ItsYourTurn.com.
hexagon-6.name: Hexagonal board (base-6)

octagon-8.description: Standard 8x8 board with the corners blocked.
octagon-8.name: Octagonal board (8x8)

octagon-10.description: Standard 10x10 board with the corners blocked.
octagon-10.name: Octagonal board (10x10)

#ruleset.description: A swap must decrease either the number of crosscuts or the number of supercuts on the board, and it must not increase the number of crosscuts.
#ruleset.name: Default rules

basic.description: A swap must decrease the number of crosscuts. Draws are possible.
basic.name: Basic rules

#rules.name: Default rules
#rules.description: Each player starts with five cards and draws one after each turn. Hands are hidden until the deck is empty.

open.name: Open hands
open.description: Each player starts with five cards and draws one after each turn. Hands are always visible.

full.name: Full deal
full.description: Deals all 24 cards to the players at the beginning of the game. All hands are visible.

plus.description: On your turn, you may place a ball or move an unpinned ball. In the case of several lines being created as a result of balls dropping, the largest line prevails.
plus.name: Spline+

#board.description: Default board that starts with a ring of neutral balls on the edges.
#board.name: 4x4 board

size-5.description: A larger 5x5 board that starts with the bottom layer filled with neutral balls.
size-5.name: 5x5 board

#setup.description: Players take turn placing balls until the pyramid is filled at the start of the game.
#setup.name: Manual setup

random.description: The pyramid is randomly filled so the game begins in the getaway phase.
random.name: Random setup

#setup.description: In the default setup, the corners of the board are empty.
#setup.name: Default setup (empty corners)

hole.description: Set up the board with four empty squares in the center.
hole.name: Center hole

random.description: Set up the board with four random empty squares.
random.name: Random gaps

hey.name: Simpler captures
hey.description: A simplification of the rules in which you always capture the pyramid you moved away from, instead of a pyramid in any line from your piece's new location.  This makes the game less like Amazons and more like Hey! That's My Fish.

finalfree.name: No final captures
finalfree.description: At the end of the game, players do not collect the pyramids under their pieces.

pieces-2.name: 2 pieces each
pieces-2.description: The piece count may optionally be reduced from 3 each to 2 each in a four-player game.  (This variant is not intended for lower player counts.)

#komi.description: One player will enter a number to choose the second mover bonus for the game. The other player will be given the option to move first or second.
#komi.name: Komi offer

#rules.description: You control a space by controlling more than half of its lines of sight.

nokomi.description: The game will be played without a second mover bonus. Good for beginners.
nokomi.name: No komi offer

tumpletore.description: You control a space by controlling more of its lines of sight than your opponent.
tumpletore.name: Tumpletore

board-modular-13.name: Modular, 13 modules (91 spaces)
board-modular-13.description: Modular boards are composed of a certain number of 7-cell modules (hexhex 2s) distributed randomly but ensuring that each module touches another at two points.

board-modular-18.name: Modular, 18 modules (126 spaces)
board-modular-18.description: Modular boards are composed of a certain number of 7-cell modules (hexhex 2s) distributed randomly but ensuring that each module touches another at two points.

size-6-fixed-lownumbers.name: Size-6 board fixed setup with low numbers

5point.description: The lower penalty makes it easier to steal enemy territory with a new line, leading to a more aggressive game.
5point.name: Lower penalty (-5)

15point.description: The higher penalty makes invading enemy territory more expensive, leading to a euro-style game that focuses on building.
15point.name: Higher penalty (-15)

#parks.name: Default park placement
#parks.description: Corners and, in two-player games, two centre cells

manualParks.name: Manual park placement
manualParks.description: Players take turns placing parks at the beginning of the game (ignored for three-player games)

parkControl.name: Park control
parkControl.description: Controlling all the open spaces around a park grants bonus points

#penalty.description: A lower penalty creates a more aggressive game, and a higher penalty, a more conservative one.
#penalty.name: Default penalty (-8)

5-10.name: Compressed range (5–10)
5-10.description: By adding 4 to the value of each centre space, the ratio of highest space to lowest is compressed from 6:1 to 2:1. This incentivizes more active competition for lower spaces.

abba.name: Balanced start
abba.description: On the first move of the game, the player only rolls one die.

#variant.description: Linnaean Sámi Tablut with historical rules based on a recent reconstruction from Linnaeus' diary. It is an edge escape variant with an armed king that is strong on the throne and on the four squares adjacent to the throne, but weak everywhere else.
#variant.name: linnaean-9x9-tcross-w

berserk-11x11-tdiamondberserk.description: Berserk variant of the Fetlar rules with knights and commanders. Multi-step captures are permitted, and the king may escape to the corner immediately after a capture.
berserk-11x11-tdiamondberserk.name: berserk-11x11-tdiamondberserk

copenhagen-11x11-tdiamond.description: Popular Hnefatafl variant based on the Fetlar rules with strong armed king and corner escape rules. Has shield wall captures and exit forts.
copenhagen-11x11-tdiamond.name: copenhagen-11x11-tdiamond

linnaean-11x11-belldiamond-w.description: Bell-diamond setup with historical rules based on a recent reconstruction from Linnaeus' diary. It is an edge escape variant with an armed king that is strong on the throne and on the four squares adjacent to the throne, but weak everywhere else.
linnaean-11x11-belldiamond-w.name: linnaean-11x11-belldiamond-w

linnaean-11x11-lewiscross-w.description: Lewis-cross setup with historical rules based on a recent reconstruction from Linnaeus' diary. It is an edge escape variant with an armed king that is strong on the throne and on the four squares adjacent to the throne, but weak everywhere else.
linnaean-11x11-lewiscross-w.name: linnaean-11x11-lewiscross-w

magpie-7x7-cross.description: A Hnefatafl variant from the book The Leprechaun Companion by Nigel Suckling. It has a strong armed King that only moves one space. The king can be captured on the edges.
magpie-7x7-cross.name: magpie-7x7-cross

seabattle-9x9-starsquare-w.description: Strong unarmed king and edge escape on a 9x9 board.
seabattle-9x9-starsquare-w.name: seabattle-9x9-starsquare-w

seabattle-11x11-tcross-w.description: Strong unarmed king and edge escape on a 11x11 board.
seabattle-11x11-tcross-w.name: seabattle-11x11-tcross-w

total-11x11-tdiamond.description: A combination of Fetlar, Copenhagen and Berserk rules. It is a strong armed king with corner escape rules, with shield wall captures, exit forts, and encirclement win. Berserk capture is enabled and the king can make a berserk escape. Repetitions result in a draw.
total-11x11-tdiamond.name: total-11x11-tdiamond

tyr-11x11-tyr.description: Berserk rules with weak armed king and edge escape on a 11x11 board. This is the default simple Tyr setup without special pieces.
tyr-11x11-tyr.name: tyr-11x11-tyr

tyr-15x15-tyr.description: Berserk rules with weak armed king and edge escape on a 15x15 board. This is the default simple Tyr setup without special pieces.
tyr-15x15-tyr.name: tyr-15x15-tyr

products.description: Multiplies together the sizes of your n largest groups.
products.name: Product

squares.description: Adds together the square of each of your n largest groups.
squares.name: Sum of Squares

#rules.description: Play on a size-5 board where plant growth destroys dirt.

high-churn.description: Play on a size-4 board where plant growth does not destroy dirt.
high-churn.name: High Churn

quick-churn.description: Play on a size-3 board where plant growth does not destroy dirt.
quick-churn.name: Small, High Churn

#capture.description: The only capture possibility is diagonally down.
#capture.name: Default capture rules

long.name: Long game
long.description: Each player starts with more pieces.

assassination.name: Assassination
assassination.description: This variant expands the capturing options, leading to a more aggressive game.

loop.name: Loop Trax
loop.description: The game must be won by a closed loop. Lines do not count in Loop Trax.

size-8.name: Size-8 board.
size-8.description: The board is limited to 8x8. If all the tiles that can be played without a win being achieved have been played, the player who plays the last tile loses.

#form.description: Play continues until all regions are claimed.
#form.name: Long form

short-form.description: Play with only three flags each.
short-form.name: Short form.

capture-delay.description: You may not place at where your opponent just placed.
capture-delay.name: Capture delay

free-neutral.description: On the first turn, place a 2-stack neutral piece, and a 1-stack piece of each player's colour.
free-neutral.name: Free neutral

#ruleset.description: Links cannot cross. You may rearrange your links before you place your peg.

pp.description: Players' own links are allowed to cross each other. There are no link rearrangements.
pp.name: Paper and pencil

monuments.description: Monuments are combinations of specific pieces in a row. Each district will score the most valuable monument present for each colour. Most valuable monument becomes the first tie breaker in districts, but not when breaking end-of-game ties.
monuments.name: Monuments

king-swap.description: Kings start on the opposing side of the board.
king-swap.name: Retrieve the King

labyrinth.description: Board size increases to 7x7 and four towers further complicate the field.
labyrinth.name: Labyrinth

moon.description: Also 7x7 board with four towers, but the towers start in slightly different places, and players are able to move the towers.
moon.name: Moon Labyrinth

#setup.description: The first player places shooters and a stone of their colour, then the second player chooses if they want to invoke the pie rule. After that the second player places more shooters and a stone, and the game begins.
#setup.name: Freestyle setup

random.description: The starting board has shooters in randomised position. The first player makes a normal move and the second player decides if they want to invoke the pie rule.
random.name: Randomised setup

hide-panel.description: Don't show panel to select orientation.
hide-panel.name: Hide panel

hide-threatened.description: Don't highlight pieces that are threatened to be removed next turn.
hide-threatened.name: Hide threatened

pips.description: Display the stones as pips instead of as numerals.
pips.name: Pips

differentiated-walls.description: Display walls placed by each player in different colours.
differentiated-walls.name: Differentated walls

hide-threatened.description: Don't highlight pieces that are threatened by cannon fire.
hide-threatened.name: Hide threatened by cannon

hide-markers.description: Don't show visual markers for the location of the corridor and scored tiles.
hide-markers.name: Hide markers

display-hex.description: Display game on the rhombus board.
display-hex.name: Display on rhombus

hide-control.name: Hide control
hide-control.description: Don't show indicators for controlled spaces.

vertex-style.name: Vertex style
vertex-style.description: Display the board using vertexes instead of hexes.

piece-numbers.name: Piece numbers
piece-numbers.description: Add numbers to the pieces to further distinguish them.

vertex-style.name: Vertex style
vertex-style.description: Display the board using vertices instead of hexes.

hide-restrictions.description: Don't show intersections where the first player cannot place their stones.
hide-restrictions.name: Hide restriction indicators

hide-focus-threatened.description: Don't put additional highlight on pieces that are threatened to be captured.
hide-focus-threatened.name: Hide focus on threatened

dot-focus-threatened.description: Use dots as an additional highlight on pieces that are threatened to be captured.
dot-focus-threatened.name: Dots on threatened

hide-controlled.description: Don't highlight controlled cells or threatened pieces for each player.
hide-controlled.name: Hide all controlled indicators

hide-blocked.description: Don't highlight cells that cannot be mined.
hide-blocked.name: Hide blocked

expanding.description: Two dimensional board, with stacks expanding when hovered over.
expanding.name: Expanding

hide-threatened.description: Don't highlight pieces that are threatened to be captured.
hide-threatened.name: Hide threatened pieces

hide-both.description: Don't highlight empty controlled intersections nor possible replacements.
hide-both.name: Hide Both

hide-influence.description: Don't highlight parts of the board that cannot be accessed by the other player.
hide-influence.name: Hide influence

vertex-board.name: Play on intersections instead of squares

hide-restrictions.description: Don't show intersections where the first player cannot place their stones.
hide-restrictions.name: Hide restriction indicators

hide-both.description: Don't highlight empty controlled spaces nor possible replacements.
hide-both.name: Hide Both

vertex-style.description: Display the board using vertexes instead of hexes.
vertex-style.name: Vertex style

flat.description: A flat view that uses shading to indicate height.
flat.name: Flat view

show-origin.description: Mark the position of the first piece.
show-origin.name: Show origin

hide-both.description: Don't show line of sight or non-suicidal captures.
hide-both.name: Hide Both

expanding.description: Two dimensional board, with stacks expanding when hovered over.
expanding.name: Expanding

isometric-20.description: Pronounced elevation: A quasi-3d view of the field where the spaces get higher as you move away from the centre.
isometric-20.name: Isometric: Pronounced Elevation

isometric-5.description: Subtle elevation: A quasi-3d view of the field where the spaces get higher as you move away from the centre.
isometric-5.name: Isometric: Subtle Elevation

homeworlds.CMD_ATK_OWNER: In games with more than two players, you have to always specify the owner of the ship you are attacking.
homeworlds.CMD_ATK_SIZE: You don't have a ship large enough to attack the ship {{target}}.
homeworlds.CMD_BUILD_TEMPLATE: You do not have a model from which to build a new ship.
homeworlds.CMD_CATA_ACTIONS: You may not trigger a catastrophe while you still have actions to use.
homeworlds.CMD_CATA_INVALID: There is no overpopulation of {{colour}} in the {{system}} system.
homeworlds.CMD_DISC_DOUBLE: A system by the name {{name}} has already been charted.
homeworlds.CMD_HOME_COLOURS: You're requesting a home world with fewer than three technologies available. This is almost never wise. If you're sure you want to do this, resubmit the command and put an asterisk (*) at the end of it.
homeworlds.CMD_HOME_DOUBLE: You already have a home world.
homeworlds.CMD_HOME_RHO_DIRECT: Your homeworld is directly connected to your right-hand opponent (none of your homeworld stars are the same size as theirs). This creates what's called a "microverse," and it is not recommended for new players. If you're sure you want to do this, resubmit the command and put an asterisk (*) at the end of it.
homeworlds.CMD_HOME_RHO_SMALL: You are choosing to put yourself only two jumps away from your right-hand opponent (what's called a "small" universe), but it's possible for you to create a "large" universe (putting your right-hand opponent at the maximum three jumps away) if you choose one of your opponent's star sizes and the size their homeworld does *not* include. For new players, starting with a large universe is recommended. If you're sure you want a small universe, resubmit the command and put an asterisk (*) at the end of it.
homeworlds.CMD_HOME_SINGLE: You're requesting a home world with only one star. This puts you at a strong disadvantage. If you're sure you want to do this, resubmit the command and put an asterisk (*) at the end of it.
homeworlds.CMD_HOME_SMALLSHIP: You are requesting a home world without a large ship. This puts you at a disadvantage. If you're sure you want to do this, resubmit the command and put an asterisk (*) at the end of it.
homeworlds.CMD_HOME_TECHS: You're requesting a home world that does not contain Green or Blue technologies. This is almost never wise. If you're sure you want to do this, resubmit the command and put an asterisk (*) at the end of it.
homeworlds.CMD_MOVE_CONNECTION: The systems {{from}} and {{to}} are not connected. You can only travel between systems that do not share any of the same-sized stars.
homeworlds.CMD_NOACTIONS_B: You have no more trade actions remaining.
homeworlds.CMD_NOACTIONS_G: You have no construction actions remaining.
homeworlds.CMD_NOACTIONS_R: You do not have any attack actions remaining.
homeworlds.CMD_NOACTIONS_Y: You have no movement actions remaining.
homeworlds.CMD_NOSYSTEM: Could not find a system with the name {{system}}.
homeworlds.CMD_NOTECH_B: You do not have access to refurbishers (BLUE) in this system.
homeworlds.CMD_NOTECH_G: You do not have access to shipyards (GREEN) in this system.
homeworlds.CMD_NOTECH_R: You do not have access to weapons technology (RED) in this system.
homeworlds.CMD_NOTECH_Y: You do not have access to propulsion technology (YELLOW) in this system.
homeworlds.CMD_PARAMETERS: The wrong number of parameters were provided.
homeworlds.CMD_PASS_FREE: You may not pass your free action.
homeworlds.CMD_PASS_TOOMANY: You tried to pass more actions than you have remaining.
homeworlds.CMD_STARSHIP_NAME: The following ship/star designation could not be understood: {{arg}}.
homeworlds.CMD_TRADE_DOUBLE: You can't trade a ship for one of the same colour.
homeworlds.CMD_TRADE_NOSIZE: There is no size {{size}} piece in the colour {{colour}}.
homeworlds.MOVE_MOREACTIONS: You still have actions to spend.
homeworlds.STASH_EMPTY: The stash has no more {{colour}} pieces left.
homeworlds.SYSTEM_BADNAME: The system name you requested ({{name}}) is invalid. Names may be no longer than 25 characters, must start with a letter or a number, and may only contain numbers, letters, hyphens, and underscores. No spaces are allowed.
homeworlds.SYSTEM_FULL: The {{system}} system is full. Home systems can only accommodate 16 ships. Periphery systems can accommodate 24.
homeworlds.SYSTEM_NOSHIP: Could not find the ship {{ship} in the {{system}} system.

chase.IMBALANCE: Current player is imbalanced by {{delta}} speed.

_inarow.CANNOT_PASS: You may not pass for the first two moves after the opening phase.

_inarow.CENTRE_OFFCENTRE: You must place your first stone in the centre of the board in the normal opening.

_inarow.NO_MOVELIST: Move list not available during this opening move. Click on the board to place stones.

chase.CHAMBER_BUMP: You may not bump pieces into the chamber.
chase.DISTANT_EXCHANGE: The cells {{left}} and {{right}} are not adjacent to each other.
chase.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_balanced: Select a piece to move. To start an exchange select the piece from which you want to remove speed, twice.
chase.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_imbalanced: You are imbalanced by {{delta}} speed. Select one of your pieces with the lowest speed to correct.
chase.INVALID_SPEED: The speed {{speed}} is not valid for {{cell}}. It must be between 1 and 6.
chase.MULTIPLE_PATHS: There is more than one way to get to {{to}} from {{from}}. Please edit the move box to add a compass direction or choose the exact move from the drop-down menu.
chase.MUST_BALANCE: You are imbalanced. Your move must begin with a '{'.
chase.NO_BALANCE: You are not imbalanced, your move can not begin with a '{'.
chase.NO_BALANCE_LEFT: You don't have any balance left to distribute to {{where}}.
chase.NOCHANGE_EXCHANGE: Exchanges must result in a change in the board state.
chase.NOPATH: There is no path from {{from}} to {{to}}.
chase.PARTIAL_BALANCE: You are still imbalanced by {{delta}} speed. Select another of your pieces with the lowest speed to correct.
chase.PARTIAL_BALANCE_PARENTHESIS: Looks like a valid balance move, close the parenthesis to continue.
chase.PARTIAL_EXCHANGE: Select another adjacent piece to make the exchange. Or click again to remove more speed.
chase.PARTIAL_MOVE: Select a destination, or select the same piece again to begin an exchange.
chase.UNEQUAL_EXCHANGE: Exchanges must result in the same combined speed. The original combined speed was {{original}}. Your requested move would change that to {{proposed}}.

churn.BAD_PLACE: If an isolated placement is available, you must make it. If that is not possible, you must form the smallest group possible.
churn.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select an empty cell to place a piece.

cifra.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_choose: Use the buttons to select your play colour and board side. Your opponent will then make the first move. "Light" refers to cells that are the background colour. "Bottom" refers to row 1.
cifra.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_setup: Select a piece from your stash to place on the board. In "King" mode, the 5 (or 9) will become the actual king.
cifra.INVALID_MOVE: The move {{move}} does not appear to be valid. Remember that you may not move or capture pieces that have made it to the far row.
cifra.NO_DUPES_cell: You may only place one piece per cell.
cifra.NO_DUPES_pc: You may only place one of each piece type on the board.
cifra.ONLY_HOME: You may only place pieces on your home row.
cifra.PARTIAL_PLACE: Select the cell on your home row to place your {{piece}} piece.
cifra.PARTIAL_SETUP_other: You have {{count}} more pieces to place.

clearcut.BAD_CROSSING: Lines may only cross if the group created by the piece placed is larger than at least one opposing group in the crosscut.
clearcut.BAD_CROSSING_CLEARCUT: Lines may only cross if the group created by the piece placed is larger than each individual opposing group in the crosscut.
clearcut.BAD_PASS: You may not pass if legal moves are available.
clearcut.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a point to place a piece.

clusterfuss.ADJ_ONLY: Pieces may only move to orthogonally adjacent spaces.
clusterfuss.BAD_PASS: You may not pass if legal moves are available.
clusterfuss.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select one of your pieces with which to capture.
clusterfuss.MUST_CAPTURE: Every move must capture, but there is no piece at {{where}} to capture.
clusterfuss.PARTIAL: Select an orthogonally adjacent piece to capture (yours or your opponent's).
clusterfuss.SINGLE_GROUP: After your capture, there must be only one orthogonally connected group that contains your own checkers.

complica.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select the column into which to drop your stone.

conect.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a cell to place a piece.
conect.NO_CENTRE: On a narrow cone, the cell {{cell}} does not exist.
conect.WRONG_CELL: The cell {{cell}} is equivalent to {{other}}. We use the latter, which is the one on the southern edge.

conhex.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a vertex to place a piece.
conhex.INVALID_VERTEX: The vertex {{vertex}} does not exist on the board.

connect6.COLLINEAR_FIRST: Your first stone must be collinear with a stone placed on the last turn.
connect6.COLLINEAR_SECOND: Your second stone must be collinear with your first stone.
connect6.EXCESS: You have placed too many stones. You may only place 2 stones.
connect6.EXCESS_FIRST: You have placed too many stones. You may only place 1 stone in the normal opening as the first player.
connect6.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select 2 intersections to place your stones.
connect6.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_SWAP3RD2: Place 2 stones in the centre 5x5 square.
connect6.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_SWAP3RD4: Select 2 intersections to place your stones, or pass to swap colours.
connect6.NO_MOVELIST: Move list not available for this game. Click on the board to place stones.
connect6.NONCOLLINEAR_SECOND: Your second stone cannot be collinear with your first stone.
connect6.ONE_MORE: Place 1 more stone on the board.
connect6.SWAP3RD2_INVALID: You may only place your stones in the centre 5x5 area for the second move in the swap-3rd opening.
connect6.SWAP3RD2_ONE_MORE: Place 1 more stone in the centre 5x5 square.

connecticut.FIRST_TRIOMINO: You may not place a triomino on the first move.
connecticut.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a vertex to place a piece, or to mark the start of the 1x3 triomino piece.
connecticut.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_FIRST: Select a vertex to place a piece. You may not place a triomino on the first move.
connecticut.INVALID_TO: You may not place a triomino at {{from}}-{{to}}.
connecticut.NORMALISE: The move needs to be normalised. Try {{normalised}}.
connecticut.PARTIAL: You may select another vertex to complete a 1x3 triomino, or complete the move to finish your turn with the single piece.

connections.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a space between your dots to draw a line.
connections.OCCUPIED: The space at {{where}} is already occupied.
connections.WRONG_ORIENT_H: The line at {{cell}} should be horizontal (suffixed with 'h').
connections.WRONG_ORIENT_V: The line at {{cell}} should be vertical (suffixed with 'v').

conspirateurs.BAD_MOVE: You may not move from {{from}} to {{to}}.
conspirateurs.BAD_PASS: You may not pass as long as you have valid moves available.
conspirateurs.BAD_PLACE: In the setup phase, pieces must be placed on unoccupied spaces in the drop zone (the marked area in the centre of the board).
conspirateurs.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_drop: Select an empty space in the drop zone to place one of your pieces.
conspirateurs.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_move: Select one of your pieces not already in a sanctuary to start to move.
conspirateurs.SAFE: You may not move pieces that have reached sanctuaries.

control.FIRST_TURN_INSTRUCTIONS: Place a piece on a space on the perimeter of the board.
control.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Place a piece on a space the opponent does not control, or remove an opponent's piece on a space you control.

courtesan.DISTANCE_ONE: Pieces may only move one space at a time.
courtesan.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select one of your pieces to move.
courtesan.INVALID_DIR: Noncapturing moves and exchanges may only happen in the forward direction.
courtesan.INVALID_EXCHANGE: Only kings may exchange, and they must transfer to a courtesan.

crossway.BAD_PASS: You may not pass if legal moves are available.
crossway.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a point to place a piece.

cubeo.BAD_MERGE: You may only merge when you have at least three dice in the formation, and you may not remove a pinned die or a die that cannot be slid out of the formation.
cubeo.BAD_MOVE_standard: When moving, the die must move its full distance (though it may backtrack at any point), end in a space that keeps the formation connected, and may not end where it started.
cubeo.BAD_MOVE_strict: When moving, the die must move its full distance (though it may backtrack at any point), end in a space that keeps the formation connected, and it must change the formation (meaning you can't move such that you simply create a rotation or reflection of the starting formation).
cubeo.BAD_PLACE: You may only place new dice such that they share an edge with at least one of your own dice and do not share *any* edges with opposing dice. The die must also be able to be slid into the formation from the outside.
cubeo.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Click an empty cell to place a new die, or one of your own dice to start a move or merge.
cubeo.MAX_DICE: You may only have {{dice}} dice on the board.

dagnacht.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Place a piece on a dark square or move a piece one square orthogonally.
dagnacht.MOVE_EMPTY: There is no piece at {{where}} to move.
dagnacht.MOVE_OCCUPIED: You can only move a piece to an empty square. There is already a piece at {{where}}.
dagnacht.NOT_BLACK: You can only place pieces on dark squares.
dagnacht.NOT_ORTH_ADJ: You can only move pieces one square orthogonally.
dagnacht.OCCUPIED: You must place a piece on an empty square. There is already a piece at {{where}}.
dagnacht.PARTIAL_MOVE: Looks like you would like to move the piece at {{cell}}. Provide the destination.
dagnacht.TOO_MANY: You can only move one piece one space

dameo.INVALID_MOVE: Remember that capturing is compulsory, as is capturing the maximum number of pieces. Movement can only happen in a forward direction, and captures can only happen orthogonally.
dameo.VALID_PARTIAL: Looks good so far. Select the next empty cell to move to.

deckfish.BAD_PASS: You may not pass if legal moves are available.
deckfish.EARLY_TO_MARKET: You cannot make a market swap now.
deckfish.INITIAL_PLACEMENT_INSTRUCTIONS: Click a card to place your piece on the board.
deckfish.INITIAL_SWAP_INSTRUCTIONS: Click a market card to swap it with one on the board.
deckfish.INVALID_FROM: You may only move your own pieces.
deckfish.INVALID_PLACEMENT: You may only place your piece on an unoccupied Ace or Crown.
deckfish.INVALID_PLACEMENT_DOUBLE: You may only place your piece on an unoccupied Ace.
deckfish.LATE_TO_MARKET: You have already selected a market card.
deckfish.MUST_PASS: You must pass as player 1 so that player 2 can begin.
deckfish.NO_SWAP: There is no card to swap at {{cell}}.
deckfish.OCCUPIED_SWAP: The card at {{cell}} is occupied by a piece and cannot be swapped.
deckfish.PARTIAL_MOVE: Click a card on the board to move your piece to.
deckfish.PARTIAL_SWAP: Click a card on the board to swap with {{what}}.
deckfish.REVERSED_MARKET: Please choose the market card to swap first..

dipole.FORWARD: Noncapturing movement must be in a forward direction.
dipole.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select one of your own stacks.
dipole.INVALID_PASS: You may not pass if you have other valid moves.
dipole.MERGE4CAPTURE: You signalled a merge, but the destination is occupied by enemy pieces.
dipole.MERGE4MOVE: You signalled a merge, but the destination is empty.
dipole.MOVE4MERGE: You signalled a move, but the destination already contains some of your own pieces.
dipole.NOTDARKSQUARE: You can only play on the dark squares.
dipole.STACK_SIZE: You may only capture stacks of equal or smaller size.
dipole.TOOFAR: You can only move as far as your stack is high.
dipole.TOOFAR_edge: The stack at {{from}} can't reach the edge from there.

dragoneyes.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_CAPTURE: Click a piece/space with a dot to begin or continue a capture chain.
dragoneyes.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_ONE: Click a gray piece to flip and reveal the owner.
dragoneyes.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_TWO: Select one of your pieces to move. Then click a space with a dot to choose where to move.

emu.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a card from your hand to place on the board.
emu.SELECT_DEST: Select the plus sign to add the card to an existing bird or to hatch a new one, or click the discard pile to discard the card.
emu.SELECT_SRC: Click the draw deck to draw a face-down card, or click the face-up card in the discard pile to draw it instead.

entrapment.BARRIER_EXISTS: There is already a barrier at {{wall}}.
entrapment.CHOOSE_SPARE: There are more than one roamers in forced positions at {{where}}. Select which one to retain.
entrapment.ENDED: The game has already ended because one player has run out of roamers.
entrapment.FORCED_FREE: You have to relieve the roamer at {{where}} if you are making a movement action.
entrapment.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_FIRST: Select a roamer to move or select an edge to place a barrier.
entrapment.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_FORCED: The roamer at {{where}} is in a forced position. Your first action must be to relieve it.
entrapment.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_SETUP: Select a space to place a roamer
entrapment.INVALID_BARRIER: The edge at {{wall}} is not a valid edge.
entrapment.INVALID_SPARE: You must choose one of the roamers at {{where}} to retain.
entrapment.INVALID_TO: You may not move the roamer from {{from}} to {{to}}.
entrapment.MISSING_DASH: To indicate movement, use a '-' followed by where you wish to move to.
entrapment.MOVE_FIRST: You must move a roamer first.
entrapment.NO_SPARE: You do not need to select any roamer to retain.
entrapment.NONEXISTENT_BARRIER: There is no barrier at {{where}} to move.
entrapment.OCCUPIED: The space at {{cell}} is already occupied.
entrapment.SECOND_ACTION: Select a roamer to move or select an edge to place a barrier.
entrapment.SECOND_ACTION_MOVE_WALL: Select a roamer to move or select a barrier to move to another edge.
entrapment.SELECT_TO_BARRIER: Select an edge to move the barrier to.
entrapment.SELECT_TO_PIECE: Select a space to move the roamer to.
entrapment.STILL_HAVE_BARRIERS: You are indicating a barrier movement with '-', but you still have barriers in your stash.
entrapment.TOO_MANY_ACTIONS: You may only perform two actions per turn.
entrapment.TOO_MANY_ACTIONS_FIRST: You may only perform one action on the first move after the setup phase.
entrapment.UNCONTROLLED_BARRIER: You may only move barriers that you control.

entropy.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_chaos: Select an empty cell on your opponent's board to place the next piece.
entropy.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_order: Select a piece on your board to move, or pass.
entropy.INVALID_MOVEMENT: You cannot move pieces in the CHAOS phase.
entropy.STRAIGHT_LINES: Pieces may only be moved in straight horizontal or vertical lines.

epam.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_move: Select the tail of the phalanx you wish to move.
epam.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_stones: Place a stone in an empty space in the middle six rows.
epam.INSUFFICIENT_FORCES: When capturing, your phalanx must have more pieces than the captured phalanx.
epam.NOPLACEMENT: You may only place pieces in the 'Stumbling Blocks' variant, when there are fewer than three stones already placed.
epam.PARTIAL: Select where you want the *head* of the phalanx to end its movement.
epam.STONES: Stones can only be placed in the middle six rows.
epam.STRAIGHTLINE: You can only move in straight lines.

exxit.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_build: Click on any unoccupied tile to place a checker, or click on a valid perimeter space to start enlarging the world.
exxit.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_destroy: A destruction move is available and must be taken. Click on one of your stacks to start.
exxit.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_setup: Select a perimeter space to place one of your tiles.
exxit.INVALID_MOVE: Click a stack you control to start a destruction dance. Otherwise, click an empty tile to place a checker or click a qualifying perimeter space to enlarge the world.
exxit.VALID_PARTIAL_dod: Select the cell where you will end your move. You have multiple options.
exxit.VALID_PARTIAL_enlargement: Multiple continuations are possible from this tile. Please select the next tile to claim.

fabrik.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_first: Select a cell in sight to place a piece, or you can pass if your opponent just placed the second worker.
fabrik.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_fresh: Place a worker in an empty cell.
fabrik.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_inprogress: Select a worker to move, or select an empty cell in sight to place a piece.
fabrik.INVALID_PASS: You may only pass the turn immediately after the second worker has been placed.
fabrik.INVALID_PLACEMENT: The cell {{where}} is not visible to both workers.
fabrik.MUST_PASS_PLAY: The first turn after the second worker has been placed must be a pass or placement.
fabrik.NOPLACEMENTS: You cannot move the workers such that you have no valid placements available.
fabrik.PARTIAL_PLACE: Choose a cell to place a piece in.

fanorona.ADJACENT: Pieces may only move to adjacent empty spaces.
fanorona.BAD_PAIKA: You have capture moves available. You may not make a noncapturing move.
fanorona.DISAMBIGUATE: You may not make further moves until you have selected a capture type for the previous move.
fanorona.EXPLICIT_CAPTURE: Each capture type must be explicitly stated. If you are clicking, then click the first enemy piece to capture. If typing, enter a '+' for approach and '-' for withdrawal.
fanorona.INVALID_CAPTURE: The capture you signalled ({{type}}) is not valid.
fanorona.MUST_CAPTURE: Each step in a piece's movement must capture.
fanorona.PAIKA_STOP: You may not move again after making a noncapturing move.
fanorona.REVISIT: When making multiple moves, the piece may never revisit the same space.
fanorona.SAME_DIR: When making multiple moves, the piece may never move in the same direction twice in a row.

fendo.DUPLICATE_FENCE: A fence already exists between these two cells.
fendo.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a piece to move or an empty space to place a piece.
fendo.INVALID_DESTINATION: You cannot reach {{to}} from {{from}}. Remember that pieces can only make one ninety-degree turn as they move.
fendo.INVALID_DIRECTION: The direction {{dir}} is not valid. It must 'N', 'E', 'S', or 'W'.
fendo.INVALID_FENCE: Placing a fence here would either create an empty closed area or create multiple open areas.
fendo.INVALID_PASS: You may not pass if you have moves available.
fendo.NO_EDGE_FENCES: You may not place fences on the edge of the board.
fendo.ONLY_MOVE_OPEN: You may only move pieces in open areas.
fendo.PARTIAL_FENCE: Provide the direction where you wish to place a fence. If clicking, click on the adjacent cell you want to block.
fendo.PLACE_IN_OPEN: You may only place pieces in the open area.
fendo.PLACE_IN_RANGE: You may only place pieces that are within one regular move of an existing piece.

fightopia.BAD_CAPTURE_pawn: Pawns can only be captured by opposing tanks if they lie along the tank's long axis and there are no obstructions.
fightopia.BAD_CAPTURE_tank: Tanks can only be captured if they are in direct contact with the enemy giant.
fightopia.FRIENDLY_FIRE: You may not capture your own pieces.
fightopia.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select one of your own pieces to move, or select the opposing piece to capture. If moving/pivoting a tank, it matters which end you click on.
fightopia.INVALID_PARTIAL: There are no valid moves based on the cell you clicked.

flume.CENTRE_START: On the first turn of the game, you may not place on the centre space.
flume.INVALID_CONTINUATION: You may only continue placing if your last placement connected with three or more other pieces.
flume.KEEP_GOING: If you make a connection with three or more pieces, you must continue placing pieces.

fnap.BAD_PASS: You may not pass your turn.
fnap.BAD_SELECTED: That tile was not selected in the previous phase.
fnap.BAD_TILE: You do not have that tile in your stash ({{tile}}).
fnap.DUPLICATE_CELL: You can't place two tiles in the same space.
fnap.DUPLICATE_TILE: You can't place the same tile twice.
fnap.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_passing: You do not have to do anything. Your opponent is making their decision and your turn will be passed.
fnap.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_place: Click on one of the selected tiles then click on an empty space on the board.
fnap.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_playOrPass: Either place the selected tiles or type "pass" to let your opponent place the tiles.
fnap.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_select: Select a tile from your stash to place.
fnap.MUST_PASS: The only move available to you is to pass.
fnap.VALID_PARTIAL_cell: Select an empty space to place the tile.
fnap.VALID_PARTIAL_tile: Select one of the two tiles to place.

focus.CAN_PLACE: If you're moving, provide the destination. If you wish to place a piece you have in hand, click the cell again.
focus.NONE_INHAND: You have no pieces in hand to place.
focus.ORTHOGONAL: Stacks may only move orthogonally, never diagonally.
focus.TOOFAR: You may not move the stack more spaces than the number of pieces in the stack.
focus.UNCONTROLLED: You can only move stacks where your piece is on top.

four.DIFFERENT_MOVE: You may not play the same size or colour piece as your opponent did on their last turn.
four.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a piece from your stash to load and manipulate it.
four.MUST_CONNECT: Each piece placed after the first must orthogonally connect to at least one other piece.
four.NO_OVERLAP: Placing a {{piece}} at {{coord}} would overlap an existing piece.
four.NO_PIECE: Could not find the piece {{piece}} in your stash.
four.NOT_ADJACENT: The placed piece may not be adjacent to a piece of the same size or colour.
four.PARTIAL: Click the cell on the board representing the top-left corner of the piece you wish to place.
four.TOO_BIG: The grid may never be larger than 9 cells wide or high (or 7 cells in the simplified game).

fourinarow.EXCESS: You have placed too many pieces. You may only place 1 piece.
fourinarow.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a supported space to place a piece.
fourinarow.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_SWAP5: Select an space to place a piece, or pass to swap colours.
fourinarow.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_SWAP21: Place three pieces on the board.
fourinarow.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_SWAP22: You may do one of (1) place a single piece to continue as player 2, (2) pass to swap colours to play as player 1, or (3) place two more pieces and allow the opponent to decide to play as player 1 or player 2.
fourinarow.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_SWAP23: You may place a piece to continue as player 1, or pass to swap colours to play as player 2.
fourinarow.NOT_PLACEABLE: You may not place at {{where}}. The piece has to be supported.
fourinarow.SWAP21_EXCESS: You have placed too many pieces. You may only place 3 pieces.
fourinarow.SWAP21_one: Place 1 more piece on the board.
fourinarow.SWAP21_other: Place {{count}} more pieces on the board.
fourinarow.SWAP22_EXCESS: You have placed too many pieces. You may only place 2 piece.
fourinarow.SWAP22_PARTIAL: Complete the move to continue as player 2, or place another piece on the board to allow the opponent to decide to play as player 1 or player 2.

frames.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Click an empty cell to add a piece to the board.

frogger.ADDITIONAL_INSTRUCTIONS: You may make up to three moves.  Choose another card or frog to start another move, or press the complete move button to finish your turn.
frogger.CARD_FIRST: Please select a hand card before moving a frog forward.
frogger.CARD_NEXT: You may click on a market card to add it to your hand, or submit your move.
frogger.CARD_NEXT_OR: You may click on a market card to add it to your hand, or start another move.
frogger.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Click a card in your hand to use to move a frog forward.
frogger.LATER_INSTRUCTIONS: Click a card in your hand to use to move a frog forward, or click a frog to move it back (and possibly draw a market card).
frogger.INVALID_MARKET_CARD: Your chosen market card must not include the suit your frog landed on.
frogger.INVALID_FROG: You may only move your own frogs.
frogger.INVALID_HOP_FORWARD: When advancing, your frog must land on the first available spot of a given suit.
frogger.INVALID_HOP_FORWARD_ADVANCED: Under the advanced rules, when playing a two-suited card from your hand, your frog must land on the first available spot of either suit (not your choice).  If both suits are present on the same board card (that is, in the same column), you may choose either spot.
frogger.INVALID_HOP_BACKWARD: When hopping back, your frog must land on the nearest available card.  If there is more than one spot available in that column, you may choose any one of them.
frogger.INVALID_MOVE: The move '{{move}}' could not be parsed.
frogger.INVALID_NON-MOVE: Unless you're blocked, you must move a frog on each of your moves.
frogger.MISPLACED_REFILL: Please request a refill before you move a frog backward.
frogger.MUST_HOP_FORWARD: When using a hand card, your frog must hop forward.
frogger.MUST_MOVE: Your frog must move to a different card/column.
frogger.MUST_PASS: You must pass to allow another player to complete their turn.
frogger.NO_CHOICE_BLOCKED: If, at the start of your turn, you have no hand cards and none of your frogs can move back, you must draw a single card from the market and end your turn.
frogger.NO_MOVE_BLOCKED: You cannot move after claiming a card for being blocked.
frogger.NO_PASSING: There is no passing as such in Frogger.  If you are blocked, you must draw a single card from the market.
frogger.NO_REFILLS: Refilling the market is not allowed in this variant.
frogger.NO_RETURN: Frogs may not leave home once they've reached it.
frogger.NO_SUCH_HAND_CARD: The card "{{card}}" does not appear to be in your hand.
frogger.NO_SUCH_MARKET_CARD: The card "{{card}}" does not appear to be in the market.
frogger.NOT_BLOCKED: You're not blocked, so you must move back before claiming a market card.
frogger.OCCUPIED: Only one frog per suit space.
frogger.OFF_BOARD: Frogs must be placed on locations with suits, at home, or at the Excuse.
frogger.OFFSIDES: Please click on your desired suit space, not the informational icons on the top row.
frogger.PIECE_NEXT: Click on a frog to move it forward or backwards.
frogger.PLACE_NEXT: Click on a new location for your frog.
frogger.TOO_HOPPY: You may not make more than {{count}} moves on your turn.
frogger.TOO_EARLY_FOR_REFILL: Please submit your refill request before making your remaining moves.
frogger.TOO_LATE_FOR_BLOCKED: You do not count as blocked if you've already moved on this turn.
frogger.TOO_LATE_FOR_REFILL: There is no need to force a market refill after your third move.  It will refill automatically after your turn.

furl.CAPTURE4UNFURL: You signalled a capture unfurl move, but {{to}} not is occupied by the opponent. Use ">" to denote non-capture unfurl.
furl.FURL4UNFURL: You signalled a furl move with "<", but the selected stack has a height of {{size}}, which is greater than 1.
furl.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a piece to furl or a stack to unfurl.
furl.INVALID_FURL: It is not possible to furl from {{from}} to {{to}}. You may only furl towards a cell where you have two or more of your 1-piece stacks in an unbroken line.
furl.INVALID_UNFURL: It is not possible to unfurl from {{from}} to {{to}}. You may only unfurl towards an empty cell or an opponent's stack exactly {{size}} spaces away. Intermediate cells must be empty.
furl.NO_FURLS: There are no furl moves possible from piece at {{from}}.
furl.NO_UNFURLS: There are no unfurl moves possible from stack at {{from}}.
furl.UNFURL4CAPTURE: You signalled a non-capture unfurl move, but a capture can be made at {{to}}. Use "x" to denote capture.
furl.UNFURL4FURL: You signalled an unfurl move with ">", but the selected stack only has a height of 1.

garden.BAD_PLACE_normal: You must plant seeds orthogonally adjacent to existing plants.
garden.BAD_PLACE_start: In the first four turns of the game, you may NOT plant a seed orthogonally adjacent to an existing plant.
garden.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_normal: Select which seed you wish to plant.
garden.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_start: Select which seed you wish to plant.
garden.INVALID_COLOUR: The only valid colours are 'w' and 'b'. You gave '{{colour}}'.

pahtum.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_offer: Place all five blocks and a single stone. Your opponent will then choose which colour to play.

paintbucket.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select any enemy cell to convert that group.

pigs.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Enter 'R' to spend your whole turn repairing, or type five of the following characters: ^ (forward), v (backward), \ (forward left), / (forward right), < (turn left), > (turn right), F (fire laser), H (hit with snout), X (when damaged)
pigs.INVALID_CMD: The character '{{cmd}}' is not a recognized command.
pigs.REPAIR_SINGLE: The repair command takes your entire turn and is entered with a single 'R' character.
pigs.TOOLONG: You may only enter five commands.
pigs.UNDAMAGED: You can't repair until you've taken damage.
pigs.X_TOOFEW: You must enter an 'X' for every point of damage taken.
pigs.X_TOOMANY: You entered too many 'X' commands. You only need to enter one for every point of damage taken.

pigs2.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_first: Enter three of the following characters: ^ (forward), v (backward), \ (forward left), / (forward right), < (turn left), > (turn right), F (fire laser), H (hit with snout). Orders will execute in the order you provide, from left to right.
pigs2.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_rest: Enter one of any of the following characters: ^ (forward), v (backward), \ (forward left), / (forward right), < (turn left), > (turn right), F (fire laser), H (hit with snout). This will get appended to the left-hand side of your current list of orders. The right-most order will execute next.
pigs2.INVALID_CMD: The character '{{cmd}}' is not a recognized command.
pigs2.TOOLONG_first: You may only enter three commands to start.
pigs2.TOOLONG_rest: You may only enter a single command on normal turns.

pikemen.BAD_FACING: The following move segment had an unrecognizeable facing: {{segment}}.

pletore.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Place a piece onto an empty intersection not controlled by the opponent, replace an enemy piece on an intersection you control, or 'pass' if all intersections are occupied or controlled. The game ends when both players pass in sequence.
pletore.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_BUTTON: Place a piece onto an empty intersection not controlled by the opponent, replace an enemy piece on an intersection you control, or take the button (worth .5 points).

pletore.INSUFFICIENT_CONTROL: You cannot replace a piece on {{cell}}. You do not control the intersection.
pletore.INVALIDBUTTON: The button is already taken or is not in use this game.
pletore.INVALIDKOMI: The first move of the game must be an integer representing the number of points the second player starts with. You may not offer a komi greater than the number of cells on the board plus one.
pletore.INVALIDPASS: You cannot pass while uncontrolled intersections exist or the button still needs to be taken.
pletore.INVALIDPIE: You cannot accept or reject a pie offer now.
pletore.KOMI_CHOICE: Invoke pie to play first or accept playing as second player.
pletore.OPPONENT_CONTROL: You cannot place onto the empty intersection {{cell}}. It is controlled by the opponent.

pods.INVALID_MOVER: You may only move your own nonisolated pieces.
