rootbound.BAD_SECOND_MOVE: You must start by making a second group as soon as possible.
rootbound.CLAIMED_CELL: You may not place a piece into a claimed territory.
rootbound.FIRST_MOVE_INSTRUCTIONS: Place a piece anywhere on the board.
rootbound.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Place one or two pieces on an unclaimed empty space. Your pieces may not form a small triangle nor can you grow a group in a straight line from an existing piece.
rootbound.RAPID_GROWTH: You cannot grow a group in a straight line from an existing piece in a single turn.
rootbound.SECOND_MOVE_INSTRUCTIONS: Place one or two pieces on empty spaces. You must make a second group as soon as possible.
rootbound.TOO_FEW_GROUPS: You cannot end a turn with only one group unless it claims territory.
rootbound.TOO_MANY_NEIGHBORS: Your pieces cannot form a small triangle.

saltire.EMPTY_FROM: You are indicating to swap but there is no piece at {{where}}.
saltire.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a point to place a piece, or select a piece to swap.
saltire.NO_SWAPPABLE: The piece at {{where}} cannot make a swap with any adjacent piece to reduce the number of crosscuts or supercuts.
saltire.NORMALISE: The move needs to be normalised. Try {{normalised}}.
saltire.SELECT_TO: Select an adjacent piece to swap with.

scaffold.INCOMPLETE: You need to place stones to connect the groups.
scaffold.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a point to place a piece.
scaffold.INVALID_MOVES: This sequence of moves {{moves}} is invalid.

shifty.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select an intersection to place a piece next to one of your own pieces, or select a piece to move.
shifty.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_OPENING: Select an intersection to place your first piece.
shifty.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_PASS: You have no moves so you must pass.
shifty.INVALID_PASS: You may not pass if you have any legal moves available.
shifty.CANNOT_PLACE: You may not place at {{where}}. Placement must be orthogonally adjacent to one of your own pieces.
shifty.CROSSCUT: You may not place at {{where}} because it creates a crosscut.
shifty.CROSSCUT_MOVE: You may not move to {{where}} because it creates a crosscut.
shifty.MOVE_NOT_ADJACENT: You may not move the piece at {{from}} because it is not orthogonally adjacent to a friently piece.
shifty.NEXT_TO_FRIENDLY: You may not move to {{where}} because it is orthogonally adjacent to a friendly piece.
shifty.INVALID_DESTINATION: The piece at {{from}} cannot move to {{to}} because it has no line of sight.

siegeofj.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a card from your hand to place on the board.
siegeofj.INVALID_MOVE: That move is invalid. Remember that every placed card must be fully supported (cards can't "hang off the edge" of a single card).
siegeofj.PARTIAL: Click the card on the board you want this card attached to.
siegeofj.VALID_BUT: That placement is valid. It's also possible to span two cards. Click "Complete Move" to keep the single parent, or click the adjacent card to span them both.

slither.CANNOT_MOVE: Advanced Slither: the piece at {{where}} cannot move because it is not part of a contiguous orthogonal group consisting of pieces of both colors.
slither.DIAGONAL: You may not place at {{where}} because it is diagonally adjacent to a piece of your colour without being orthogonally connected.
slither.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a point to place a piece.
slither.INVALID_PASS: You may only pass if you have no other moves available.
slither.NEED_PLACEMENT_DIAGONAL: You must place a piece at one of the dotted intersections.
slither.NO_VALID_FOLLOWUP: Movement to {{to}} will not result in a valid follow-up move.
slither.NOT_ADJACENT: {{to}} is not orthogonally or diagonally adjacent to the piece at {{from}}.
slither.PLACEMENT_MADE: You have already made a move at {{where}}.

slyde.FIXED_PIECE_FROM: The selected piece at {{from}} is fixed and cannot be moved.
slyde.FIXED_PIECE_TO: The selected piece at {{to}} is fixed and cannot be swapped with.
slyde.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a mobile piece to swap.
slyde.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_SYMMETRIC: Current board state is symmetric. Select a mobile piece to swap, or select a piece to change its state.
slyde.NO_CHANGE_FIRST_MOVE: You may not change the state of a piece on the first move.
slyde.NO_MOVES_FROM: The selected piece at {{from}} has no available moves.
slyde.NON_SYMMETRIC: The board state is not symmetric. You may not change the state of a piece.
slyde.NOT_ADJACENT: The selected piece at {{to}} is not adjacent to the piece at {{from}}.
slyde.ONLY_CHANGE: The selected piece at {{from}} cannot be moved.
slyde.SAME_PLAYER: You may not swap a piece with another piece of the same colour.
slyde.SELECT_CHANGE: Select the piece again to change its state.
slyde.SELECT_DESTINATION: Select a destination to move the piece to.
slyde.SELECT_DESTINATION_OR_CHANGE: Select a destination to move the piece to, or select the piece again to change its state.

spire.CANNOT_PLACE: {{where}} is not a valid place to put a ball.
spire.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a space to a ball of your colour, or a neutral ball before placing ball of your colour.
spire.PLACE_PLAYER: Complete your turn to have a ball of your colour at {{where}}, or select another space to place a ball of your colour.
spire.PLACE_PLAYER_MANDATORY: Select another space to place a ball of your colour.
spire.TOO_MANY_MOVES: You may only place up to two balls on your turn.
spire.VIOLATES_BOTH: Placement at {{where}} is illegal for both the neutral ball and the ball of your colour.
spire.VIOLATES_NEUTRAL_L: You may not place a neutral ball at {{where}} because it creates 3 neutral balls in a 2x2 area.
spire.VIOLATES_NEUTRAL_PLATFORM: You may not place a neutral ball at {{where}} because platform has two neutral balls.
spire.VIOLATES_PLAYER_L: You may not place a ball of your colour at {{where}} because it creates 3 balls of your colour in a 2x2 area.
spire.VIOLATES_PLAYER_PLATFORM: You may not place a ball of your colour at {{where}} because platform has two balls of your colour.

spline.CANNOT_MOVE: The selected ball at {{where}} cannot be moved.
spline.CANNOT_PLACE: {{where}} is not a valid place to put a ball.
spline.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a space to place a ball, or select a ball to move.
spline.INVALID_TO: The selected ball at {{from}} cannot move to {{to}}
spline.MOVE_TO: Select a destination to move your ball.
spline.NO_TOS: The selected ball at {{where}} has no possible destinations.

sploof.CANNOT_PLACE: {{where}} is not a valid place to put a ball.
sploof.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a space to place a ball of your colour, or select a neutral ball to take.
sploof.NO_BALLS_HAND: You have no balls in your hand, so you cannot place a ball of your colour.
sploof.NO_BALLS_STASH: You have no balls in your stash, so you cannot take a neutral ball.
sploof.NOT_NEUTRAL: You have indicated that you want to take a neutral ball, but the ball at {{where}} is not neutral.
sploof.PINNED: The neutral ball at {{where}} is pinned.
sploof.UNOCCUPIED: You have indicated that you want to take a neutral ball, but there is no neutral ball at {{where}}.

sponnect.CONSECUTIVE_PASS: You may not pass if your opponent just passed.
sponnect.FIRST_PASS: You may not pass on the first turn.
sponnect.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a space to place a ball.
sponnect.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_PASS: Select a space to place a ball, or pass your turn.

spook.CHAIN_WRONG_PLAYER: You may only make chain captures of balls of the same colour.
spook.CONTINUE: You may have Spooky continue to capture more balls of the same colour, or end your turn.
spook.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_CAPTURE: Select an adjacent ball to capture.
spook.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_ISOLATED: Spooky is isolated. Select a new space to move Spooky.
spook.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_PARITY_PASS: Player 1 starts the getaway phase. You must pass.
spook.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_PASS: There are no adjacent free balls and unpinned opponent balls. You must pass.
spook.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_PLACEMENT: Select a space to place a ball.
spook.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_REMOVE: There are no adjacent free balls. Select an unpinned opponent ball to be removed.
spook.INVALID_PASS: You may only pass if you have no other moves available.
spook.NO_ADJACENT: The space at {{where}} is also not adjacent to any balls.
spook.NOT_ADJACENT: The ball at {{where}} is not orthogonally adjacent to Spooky.
spook.NOT_CAPTURABLE: The ball at {{where}} is not capturable.
spook.NOT_FREE: The ball at {{where}} is not free to be captured.
spook.REMOVE_WRONG_PLAYER: You must remove your opponent's ball; not your own.
spook.SINGLE_MOVE_DROP: When performing drop captures, you may only capture one ball.
spook.SINGLE_MOVE_MOVE: You may not select more than one location to move Spooky.
spook.SINGLE_MOVE_PLACE: You may only place one ball.
spook.SINGLE_MOVE_REMOVE: You may only remove one ball.
spook.WRONG_PREFIX_PLACE: Placements should not include a prefix.

spree.ALREADY_WON: You have already won the game, so you don't have to pick a colour to hand to your opponent.
spree.CANNOT_PLACE: {{where}} is not a valid place to put a ball.
spree.CHOOSE_NEXT: Choose a colour to hand to your opponent.
spree.FIRST_MOVE_CHOICE: The first move must be the ball to hand to your opponent (1, 2, or 3).
spree.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a space to place the ball of colour {{choice}}, then choose a colour to hand to your opponent.
spree.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_FIRST: Choose a colour to hand to your opponent.
spree.INVALID_CHOICE: Colour choice {{choice}} is not valid. Choose 1, 2, or 3.
spree.PLACE_FIRST: You must place the ball before choosing a colour to hand to your opponent.
spree.SAME_CHOICE: You cannot hand your opponent the colour {{choice}} because the same colour cannot be chosen twice in a row.

squaredance.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select the pivot stone. This is the stone that won't move.
squaredance.PARTIAL_DESTINATION: Select the point where the end stone will end up. You may not cover friendly pieces, and any covered enemy pieces will be captured.
squaredance.PARTIAL_ENDSTONE: Select the end stone. This is the stone that will move the furthest.

stairs.INVALID_MOVE: You must move a piece to a neighboring stack of the same height. You must move one of your lowest movable pieces.
stairs.MUST_PASS: The only move available to you is to pass.

stawvs.BAD_CLAIM: You must claim a pyramid in a straight, unobstructed line from your new position.
stawvs.BAD_CLAIM_HEY: In this variant, you must claim the pyramid from your previous position.
stawvs.BAD_MOVE: You must move to a pyramid in a straight, unobstructed line from your old position.
stawvs.BAD_START: You must choose one of your own pieces to move.
stawvs.BAD_PLACEMENT: You must place your cap on an unoccupied pyramid, not on an occupied one or an empty cell.
stawvs.EXTRA_CLAIMS: You may only claim one pyramid on your turn.
stawvs.INITIAL_PLACEMENT_INSTRUCTIONS: Click a pyramid to place your piece on the board.
stawvs.MUST_PASS: Once you have passed, you must continue passing.
stawvs.NOPASS: You cannot pass while you have legal moves.
stawvs.PARTIAL_CLAIM: Click an accessible target pyramid to claim it.

stibro.FIRST_PLACEMENT: The first placement cannot be on the edge.
stibro.FREE_GROUPS_AFTER: You must always have at least one free group: a group that does not touch the edge, and has two spaces between itself and an opponent group that does not touch the edge.

stigmergy.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Place a piece onto an empty space not controlled by the opponent, replace an enemy piece on a space you control, or 'pass' if all spaces are occupied or controlled. The game ends when both players pass in sequence.
stigmergy.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_BUTTON: Place a piece onto an empty space not controlled by the opponent, replace an enemy piece on a space you control, or "Take button" (worth .5 points).
stigmergy.INITIAL_SETUP: Enter a number to set the bonus to the second mover's score. Your opponent will choose to move first or second.
stigmergy.INSUFFICIENT_LOS: You cannot replace a piece on {{cell}}. You do not control the space.
stigmergy.INVALIDBUTTON: The button is already taken or is not in use this game.
stigmergy.INVALIDKOMI: You must choose a number of points for the second mover to start with. You may not offer a komi greater than the number of cells on the board plus one.
stigmergy.INVALIDPASS: You cannot pass while uncontrolled spaces exist or if the button is still available for taking.
stigmergy.INVALIDPLAYSECOND: You cannot choose to play second from this board state.
stigmergy.KOMI_CHOICE: You may either make the first move on the board and let your opponent keep the bonus points or you may choose "Play second" and take the bonus points for yourself.
stigmergy.OPPONENT_CONTROL: You cannot place onto the empty space {{cell}}. It is controlled by the opponent.

storisende.BAD_DISTANCE: Stacks must move a distance exactly equal to their height.
storisende.BAD_PLACEMENT: Pieces may only be placed on valid hexes not already occupied by your opponent.
storisende.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_first: Click cell to place a piece. Click the same cell multiple times to create a stack. You must place 2–5 total pieces, then your opponent will choose sides.
storisende.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_second: You may either switch seats or choose to play second by placing the same number of pieces. If your opponent already switched seats, then you may only place pieces. Click a cell to place a piece. Click the same cell multiple times to create a stack.
storisende.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_rest: Click a stack to move. The number of pieces that move depend on the distance you travel.
storisende.INVALID_SUBSTACK: The substack notation is incorrect. You're trying to move more pieces than are available. If trying to move the entire stack, don't specify the stack height.
storisende.PARTIAL_PLACE_FIRST_one: You may place one more piece.
storisende.PARTIAL_PLACE_FIRST_MORE: You must place at least one more piece
storisende.PARTIAL_PLACE_SECOND_one: You must place one more piece.
storisende.STRAIGHT_ONLY: Pieces may only move in straight lines.
storisende.TOO_MANY: You placed too many pieces. Please reset the move and try again.
storisende.WALL_CLIMB: Pieces may not move from the ground onto a wall tile.
storisende.WALL_JUMP: Pieces may only jump over a wall tile if that tile contains at least one of your own pieces.

stormc.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select one of your pieces to move.

strands.DIFFERENT_NUMS: You have to select spaces with the same number.
strands.DUPLICATE: You have already placed a piece at {{where}}.
strands.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select the spaces to place your pieces.
strands.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_FIRST: Select a space numbered 2 for the first move.
strands.INITIAL_SINGLE: You may only place one piece on a space numbered 2 for the first move.
strands.INITIAL_TWO: You must place a piece on a space numbered 2 for the first move.
strands.INVALID_PLACEMENT: Unable to interpret the move notation: {{move}}.
strands.NORMALISE: The move needs to be normalised. Try {{normalised}}.
strands.PLACE_MORE_one: Place 1 more piece on a space numbered {{num}}.
strands.PLACE_MORE_other: Place {{count}} more pieces on spaces numbered {{num}}.

streetcar.ADJ_TO_BLDG: You may not remove a housing limit next to a building.
streetcar.FIRST_HOUSE: You may not remove a housing limit on the first turn.
streetcar.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_initial: Click one or two hex edges to start your streetcar empire.
streetcar.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_normal: In any order, click a hex to remove a housing limit, and click one or two hex edges to expand your streetcar empire.
streetcar.INVALID_EDGE: The edge provided does not appear to be valid: {{edge}}.
streetcar.MUST_TOUCH: When claiming two edges, they must touch.
streetcar.NO_REMOVE_BLDGS: You may not remove buildings from the board.
streetcar.ONLY_TWO: You may only claim two edges per turn.
streetcar.TWO_LINES: You must place a second line if extending your first line is legal.
streetcar.VALID_PARTIAL_haveedge: So far so good. Select a housing limit to remove.
streetcar.VALID_PARTIAL_havehouse: So far so good. Select at least one edge.

subdivision.BAD_ONE: Smalls must be placed near a small or large of a different colour.
subdivision.BAD_PARK: You may not place any more parks. If you're trying to place a piece, first click the piece in your stash.
subdivision.BAD_PASS: You may not pass if legal moves are available.
subdivision.BAD_THREE: Larges may not be placed near another large of your colour.
subdivision.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_parks: Click an empty cell to place a park.
subdivision.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_place: Click a piece in your stash to place on the board.
subdivision.INVALID_SIZE: The piece you selected is invalid. It must be a 1, 2, or 3.
subdivision.MALFORMED: Your move could not be interpreted. If this persists, please let an administrator know.
subdivision.NEED_PARKS: You may not place a piece until all parks are placed. Click an empty cell to place a park.
subdivision.NO_PIECE: You don't have a size {{size}} piece to place.
subdivision.PARTIAL_PLACEMENT: Click an empty space on the board to place your {{size}} piece.

sunspot.OPTIONAL_FLIP: You may submit the move as-is, or you may additionally flip an interior stone that is part of a combined group to your colour.
sunspot.MANDATORY_COUNTERFLIP: You must flip one of your own edge subgroups in the same group as the flipped stone.

surmount.BAD_CAP: You may not capture the stone at {{cell}}. The captured stone must be adjacent to the capturing group and must be part of a group that is the same size as the capturing group.
surmount.BAD_CONTINUE: You may not place a stone at {{cell}}. Continuations may not make contact with any groups other than those initially contacted, and they may not grow the group any larger than the largest enemy group initially contacted.
surmount.BAD_INIT_CAP: You may not capture the stone at {{cell}}. The captured stone must be adjacent to one of your groups that are larger than the target group.
surmount.BAD_PASS: You may not pass if legal moves are available.
surmount.CANT_CONTINUE: You may not place more stones unless the first stone ({{start}}) touches at least one friendly stone and at least one enemy group that is the same size or larger then the friendly group.
surmount.DEAD_END: There are no valid continuations available but you are not yet large enough to capture. Reset and try a different approach.
surmount.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select an empty cell to place a piece, or select a capturable stone to capture it and destroy the group.
surmount.PARTIAL_BOTH: Either continue placing stones or select one of the highlighted enemy cells to capture it and destroy that group.
surmount.PARTIAL_CAP: Select one of the highlighted enemy cells to capture it and destroy that group.
surmount.PARTIAL_CONTINUE: Continue placing stones until the group is the same size of one of the contacted enemy groups.

susan.EMPTY_FROM: You have indicated a sliding move, but there is no piece at {{where}}.
susan.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a space to place a piece, or select one of your pieces to slide to an adjacent space.
susan.NOT_ADJACENT: The selected cell {{to}} is not adjacent to {{from}}
susan.SELECT_TO: Select a space to slide your piece.
susan.WRONG_PLAYER: You may only slide your own pieces.

symple.BAD_PLACEMENT: You cannot create a new group by placing at {{where}}.
symple.CAN_BALANCE: You are permitted to create a new group if you wish.
symple.CANT_BALANCE: You may not grow and create a new group in the same turn.
symple.DOUBLE_GROW: You may not cause a group to be grown more than once in a turn.
symple.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Click a cell to add a piece to the board.
symple.NOT_LIBERTY: The cell {{where}} is either not a liberty of one of your groups, or the group has already been grown during this turn.
symple.PARTIAL: So far so good. Keep placing pieces until you have expanded all groups you legally can.
symple.TOO_LONG: You may not add more stones if your first move is to create a new group.

tablero.BACKTRACKING: When moving a stack, you may not revisit any previous space, including the starting space.
tablero.BAD_BUMP: You may not bump if you have legal moves available, including taking a piece into your hand if you rolled doubles.
tablero.BAD_TAKE: You may only take a piece off the board if you rolled doubles.
tablero.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select an empty space to place a piece or select a stack you control to begin movement. Click the "Bump" or "Take" buttons to take one of those actions.
tablero.INVALID_MOVE: The move does not appear to be legal. Remember that you can only use each die once.
tablero.NOT_HOME: You may only place pieces or move stacks on your home row.
tablero.PARTIAL_MOVE_one: Keep moving until you have dropped all the pieces from the stack. You have {{count}} checker left to drop.
tablero.PARTIAL_MOVE_other: Keep moving until you have dropped all the pieces from the stack. You have {{count}} checkers left to drop.
tablero.PARTIAL_PLACE: Choose the cell where you wish to place the checker.
tablero.PARTIAL_TAKE: Click the stack you control from which you wish to remove a checker.
tablero.VALID_PARTIAL: First move complete. Now make a second.

tafl.BERSERK_CONTINUE: You may continue with a berserk move.
tafl.CONTIGUOUS: In berserk moves, the subsequent 'from' cells must be the previous 'to' cells.
tafl.INVALID_DESTINATION: The piece at {{from}} cannot move to {{to}}.
tafl.NO_MOVES: The piece at {{from}} does not have any valid cells to move to.
tafl.NORMALISE: The move needs to be normalised. Try {{normalised}}.
tafl.PREFIX: The cell {{cell}} has to be prefixed with the piece symbol: {{prefixed}}

taiji.ADJACENT: Pieces must be placed adjacent to each other. Diagonal placement is only permitted in the "Tonga" variant.
taiji.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Place a light piece in an empty space.
taiji.NO_NEIGHBOUR: That space has no valid empty neighbour.
taiji.PARTIAL: Place the dark piece in an adjacent empty space.

take.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Plant a new seed in dirt, or grow a plant by placing adjacent to exactly one ally piece (dirt or no dirt).

tbt.BAD_PASS: You must move a stack if it's possible to do so.
tbt.NO_REVERSE: You may not simply reverse your opponent's last move.
tbt.NOT_ORTH: The cells {{from}} and {{to}} are not orthogonal to each other.
tbt.TOO_SHORT: The stack at {{where}} is too short (it needs at least {{roll}} pieces).

terrace.BAD_CAPTURE_ranked: All captures must be adjacent. When capturing straight up, you must be larger (except that a smallest-size may assassinate a largest-size piece). When capturing same level, you must be at least the same size. When capturing diagonally down, you may be one rank smaller.
terrace.BAD_CAPTURE_standard: You may only capture a piece your size or smaller, diagonally down.
terrace.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select one of your pieces to move.
terrace.MOVE_DOWN: You may only move straight down and only one level at a time.
terrace.MOVE_SAME_LEVEL: You may not jump over enemy pieces when moving on the same level.
terrace.MOVE_UP: You may only move one level at a time to an adjacent cell.
terrace.NO_MOVES: The piece at {{cell}} does not have any valid moves.

tessella.PARTIAL_cancap: Select a destination. This piece can capture.
tessella.PARTIAL_move: Select a destination. This piece may only move.

tintas.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_movepawn: Select the cell where you want the pawn to move.
tintas.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_needpawn: Select where to place the pawn.
tintas.OCCUPIED_MOVE: The pawn must move to an occupied space.
tintas.SAME_COLOUR: When capturing multiple pieces, they must all be the same colour.
tintas.STRAIGHT_LINE: There is no straightline connection between {{from}} and {{to}}.

toguz.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select the pit you wish to sow. It must be on your side of the board and cannot be a tuz (square-shaped pit).
toguz.NO_TUZ: You may not sow the seeds in your tuz.

trax.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a tile, then select a space to place it.
trax.FIRST_PIECE_POSITION: The first move must be either '@0+' or '@0/'.
trax.SELECT_CELL: Select a cell to place the tile.
trax.NO_NEIGHBOURS: The selected cell at {{where}} has no neighbours.
trax.INVALID_FOLLOWUP: Placement of a {{piece}} at {{where}} results in an invalid followup.
trax.NO_EXPAND_X: You may not expand the board beyond a width of {{size}}.
trax.NO_EXPAND_Y: You may not expand the board beyond a height of {{size}}.

trike.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select the cell to place the neutral piece on.

tritium.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a tile or your own flag.
tritium.EMPTY: Cell {{cell}} is empty, flags must be placed on top of existing regions.
tritium.NON_FREE_REGION: The region at {{cell}} is not free.
tritium.NO_PREPARED_FLAG: You do not have a prepared flag.

tumbleweed.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Place a piece on the board.
tumbleweed.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_PASS: Either invoke the pie rule to play as first player or pass to play as second. If pie was already invoked, your only option is to pass.
tumbleweed.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_SETUP: Setup phase: place a piece of your colour, then place a piece of your opponent's colour.
tumbleweed.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_SETUP_FREENEUTRAL: Setup phase: place a neutral stack-2 piece, then place a piece of your colour, and then place a piece of your opponent's colour.
tumbleweed.PASS_1ST: You may not pass on the first ply.
tumbleweed.PASS_2ND: Either invoke the pie rule to play as first player or pass to play as second. If pie was already invoked, your only option is to pass.
tumbleweed.PASS_3RD: You may not pass on the third ply.
tumbleweed.INSUFFICIENT_LOS: There is insufficient line of sight to place a piece on {{cell}}.
tumbleweed.DUPLICATE: You have already placed a piece at {{where}}.
tumbleweed.FREENEUTRAL1: Select a cell to place a piece of your colour.
tumbleweed.FREENEUTRAL2: Select a cell to place a piece of your opponent's colour.
tumbleweed.ONE_MORE: Place a piece of your opponent's colour.
tumbleweed.SAME_CELL: In the setup phase, place two pieces on different cells.
tumbleweed.TOO_MANY: You may only place one piece per turn after the setup phase.
tumbleweed.TOO_MANY_OPENING: You may only place two pieces in the setup phase.
tumbleweed.TOO_MANY_OPENING_FREENEUTRAL: You may only place three pieces in the setup phase.
tumbleweed.NO_REPLACE: In this variant, you may not place at a cell where your opponent just placed.
tumbleweed.REINFORCE_NOTATION: Reinforcement moves must be suffixed with '+'. Try '{{move}}'
tumbleweed.CAPTURE_NOTATION: Capture moves must be suffixed with 'x'. Try '{{move}}'
tumbleweed.NO_MOVELIST: Move list not available during placement phase for the freestyle variant. Click on the board to place the pieces.

twixt.CORNER: You may not place a peg at the corner of the board.
twixt.CROSSING: The link at {{link}} is making an illegal cross.
twixt.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a space to place a peg. You may rearrange your links before you place your peg.
twixt.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_PP: Select a space to place a peg
twixt.INVALID_LINK: The link at from {{from}} to {{to}} is invalid.
twixt.LINK_ABSENT: There is no link between {{link}} to remove.
twixt.LINK_ON_WRONG_PLAYER: You may only place a link on a peg of your own colour.
twixt.LINK_PRESENT: There is already a link between at {{link}}.
twixt.NO_PEG: When placing a link at {{link}}, there is no peg at {{peg}}.
twixt.NORMALISED: The move needs to be normalised. Try {{normalised}}.
twixt.OCCUPIED: The space {{move}} is already occupied by a peg.
twixt.OPPONENTS_AREA: You may not place a peg in your opponent's area.
twixt.PARTIAL_EMPTY: Trying to begin a partial move at an empty space {{move}}.
twixt.PARTIAL_LINK: Select another peg to add or remove a link to.
twixt.PARTIAL_OPPONENT: You may not rearrange your opponent's links.
twixt.TOO_MANY_PEGS: You may only place one peg per turn.

unlur.BAD_PASS: The contract phase is over. You may no longer pass.
unlur.CONTRACT_EDGE: You may not place a piece on the edges of the board in the contract phase.
unlur.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a cell to place a piece, or pass to play as the Y player.
unlur.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_PASSED: Select a cell to place a piece.

upperhand.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a space to place a ball.

urbino.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_first: Select a cell in sight to place a piece, or you may pass if your opponent just placed the second architect.
urbino.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_fresh: Place an architect in an empty cell.
urbino.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_inprogress: Select an architect to move or select the size of a piece to place.
urbino.INVALID_PASS: You may only pass if you have no other moves available.
urbino.INVALID_PIECE: You don't have a {{piece}} in your stash to place.
urbino.INVALID_PLACE_CELL: The cell {{where}} is not visible to both architects.

INVALID_PLACE_PIECE.house: You may not place a house here because it would create multiple blocks of one colour.
INVALID_PLACE_PIECE.palace: You may not place a palace here either because there is a palace adjacent or it would create multiple blocks of one colour.
INVALID_PLACE_PIECE.tower: You may not place a tower here either because there is a tower adjacent or it would create multiple blocks of one colour.

urbino.MUST_PASS_PLAY: The first turn after the second worker has been placed must be a pass or placement.
urbino.NOPLACEMENTS: You cannot move the workers such that you have no valid placements available.
urbino.PARTIAL_PLACE: Choose a cell to place a piece in.
urbino.PARTIAL_PLACE_SIZE: Select the size of a piece to place.

valley.BAD_VARIANT: You can only move towers in the Moon Labyrinth variant.
valley.KING_ONLY: Only the king may end its turn on the centre space.
valley.NO_STOPPING: Pieces must move in their chosen direction until stopped by the edge of the board or another piece.
valley.NO_TOKENS: You may only move towers when you have moon tokens.
valley.PAWN_FIRST: The first move of the game cannot be made with the king.
valley.TOWER_NO_TAKEBACKS: You may not just immediately undo an opponent's tower move.
valley.TOWER_SINGLE_STEP: Towers may only move one space.

veletas.DUPLICATE: You have already placed a shooter at {{where}}.
veletas.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a shooter to move or select a cell to place your piece.
veletas.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_PLACE_one: Place {{count}} more shooter an empty space on the board, then place a piece of your colour on the board.
veletas.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_PLACE_other: Place {{count}} more shooters on empty spaces on the board, then place a piece of your colour on the board.
veletas.INVALID_PLACEMENT: Unable to interpret the move notation: {{move}}.
veletas.MOVE_NON_SHOOTER: You may only move free shooters.
veletas.NO_MOVELIST: Move list not available during placement phase. Click on the board to place the shooters.
veletas.PLACE_PIECE: Place a piece of your colour on the board.
veletas.PLACE_SHOOTER_one: Place {{count}} more shooter on the board, then place a piece of your colour on the board.
veletas.PLACE_SHOOTER_other: Place {{count}} more shooters on the board, then place a piece of your colour on the board.
veletas.POTENTIAL_BLOCK: So far so good. Provide the space you want to place your piece at.
veletas.POTENTIAL_MOVE: So far so good. Provide the space you want to move the shooter to.
veletas.SHOOTER_PERIMETER: Shooters may not be placed on the perimeter of the board.
veletas.SORTED: The move list needs to be sorted. Try {{normalised}}.
veletas.STATIONARY_LOS: There is no line of sight to place at {{where}}.
veletas.STRAIGHTLINE: You can only move and place in straight lines.

verge.FROZEN_NEIGHBOUR: You cannot place next one of your frozen groups.
verge.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select an empty cell that is not adjacent to one of your frozen groups.

volcano.BAD_FROM: {{from}} doesn't look like a position on the board, or a piece in your stash.
volcano.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select a cap to move or a piece from your captured pile to place on the board.
volcano.MOVES_AFTER_ERUPTION: You may not continue moving after causing an eruption.
volcano.MOVES_DOUBLE_CAP: Nothing may be placed on top of a cap.
volcano.MOVES_MUST_ERUPT: You must continue moving until you cause an eruption.
volcano.MOVES_NOPIECE: You don't have a {{piece}} piece in your stash to place.
volcano.MOVES_ONE_POWERPLAY: You may only make one power play per turn.
volcano.MOVES_ONE_SPACE: Caps may only be moved one space at a time.
volcano.PARTIAL_ERUPTION: Keep moving caps until you cause an eruption.

volo.BEARING: The range {{range}} does not result in a valid bearing.
volo.CHOOSE_REGION: You have created new regions containing your opponent's birds. Select one of the {{count}} regions to retain.
volo.CONTROLLED_REGION: You may not place a bird at {{where}} because it would be in a region controlled by your opponent.
volo.END_OR_MOVE_DIRECTION: Select another bird to create a flock, or select a destination to move the single bird to.
volo.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select an intersection to add a bird, or select a flock of birds to move.
volo.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_PASS: Select an intersection to add a bird, or select a flock of birds to move, or pass.
volo.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS_PASS_ONLY: You have run out of moves. You may only pass.
volo.INVALID_DIRDIST: The direction and distance {{dirDist}} is invalid.
volo.INVALID_PASS: You may only pass if your only placement is in regions of your own or if you have run out of moves.
volo.INVALID_REGION: The region {{choice}} is not valid. Select one of the regions ({{choices}}) to retain.
volo.INVALID_REGION_NORMALISE: The region that contains {{choice}} is represented by {{represent}}. Try '{{normalised}}'
volo.MOVE_DIRECTION: Select a destination to move the flock to.
volo.NO_REGIONS_TO_SELECT: You have indicated a region selection, but there are no regions to select from.
volo.NORMALISE: The move needs to be normalised. Try '{{normalised}}'.
volo.PLACE_FRIENDLY_NEIGHBOUR: You may not place a bird at {{where}} because it would be adjacent to a friendly bird.
volo.SAME_START_END: The start and end points are the same.
volo.SINGLE_LINE: The {{range}} is not a straight unbroken line of your birds.

witch.2P_PRIVILEGE: Only the second player may choose the pieces they wish to play.
witch.AFFILIATE: Choose which piece you wish to play by clicking any sun or moon piece.
witch.BOTH_EMPTY: When selecting a line of pieces, both the start and end cells must be empty.
witch.EMPTY_CAPTURE: Captures must include at least one piece.
witch.INCOMPLETE_AFFILIATION: To choose your affiliation, the move must start with '(S)' or '(M)'.
witch.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Click a piece to remove or an empty space to start removing a line of pieces.
witch.NO_CROWNS: You may not pick up crowns directly.
witch.NO_ENEMY: You may not pick up your opponent's pieces.
witch.ORTHOGONAL: Lines of pieces must be horizontal or vertical, never diagonal.
witch.PARTIAL: Select another empty space to remove the pieces in between.
witch.UNBROKEN: Lines of pieces must be unbroken by empty cells.

wyke.CELL_CLAIMED: The cell {{cell}} has already been claimed and cannot be interacted with further.
wyke.DUPLICATE_CELLS: You can't select the same cell multiple times.
wyke.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select an available move from the button bar.
wyke.INVALID_FORMAT: Your move is in an invalid format: "{{move}}". It should start with the move type followed by a list of cells in parentheses (e.g., "3-1 (a1,b2)").
wyke.INVALID_MOVETYPE: The move "{{move}}" is not one of the five allowed movement types.
wyke.MOVETYPE_UNAVAILABLE: That move type is unavailable. Only select moves that are not stricken through.
wyke.PARTIAL: Continue selecting cells until the move is complete.
wyke.TOO_FEW_PIECES: There are too few pieces at {{where}} to remove {{num}} of them.
wyke.TOO_MANY_CELLS: You have selected more cells than the move type allows.
wyke.TOO_MANY_PIECES: There are too many pieces at {{where}} to add {{num}} more.

yavalath.BAD_PASS: You may only pass if you have been eliminated.
yavalath.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Click an empty cell to place a piece.
yavalath.MUST_BLOCK: In a three-player game, you must block a next-opponent win if possible.

yonmoque.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select an empty cell to place a piece or an existing piece to start a move.

zola.DISTANCE_CAPTURES: Capture moves must not increase your distance from the centre.
zola.DISTANCE_NONCAPTURES: Non-capture moves must increase your distance from the centre.
zola.INITIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Select one of your own pieces.
zola.MUST_MOVE: If you have a move available you can not pass your turn.
zola.NONCAPTURES_KINGS: Non-capturing moves can only move one space at a time.

INITIAL_UNDO: You can't undo the initial starting position of the game.
MOVES_GAMEOVER: You cannot make moves in concluded games.
MOVES_INVALID: The move '{{move}}' is invalid. Please check the rules and try again.
MOVES_SIMULTANEOUS_PARTIAL: In simultaneous games, both players' moves must be submitted at the same time.
